did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle:
Diane Williams Collection of Papers and Photographs,
1966-1991

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.abstract: The collection contains a small amount of correspondence, concert programs and advertisements, clippings, and photographs.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], Diane Williams Collection of Papers and Photographs, 1966-1991, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection does not reside with the Music Library. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Diane Wiens Williams was born 22 November 1940 in Kansas City, Missouri. She earned her Bachelor's Degree in Music from Oberlin, with studies in viola with William Berman and in voice with Robert Fountain. She continued her studies at the Manhattan School of Music where she studied viola with William Lincer and Lillian Fuchs. Later, she earned a Master's Degree in School Counseling at the University at Buffalo.

Diane Williams moved to Buffalo with her husband, percussionist Jan Williams, in 1964. The couple met while attending the Manhattan School of Music and married in 1962. She was hired as a member of the viola section in the Buffalo Philharmonic Orchestra in 1964 and remained in the position until 1996. Williams has also performed at the Ojai Music Festival in California, the Cayuga Chamber Orchestra, the Western New York Chamber Orchestra, the Erie Philharmonic, the SONOR ensemble at the University of California at San Diego. She often performed with various chamber ensembles in Buffalo, including the Custer and Taub string quartets, and the Camenae String Quartet of which she was a founding member.

Diane Williams is a member and officer of the Wednesday Morning Musicale, an organization of women musicians in Western New York founded in 1925. She has served as a New York State certified Ombudsman at a Buffalo inner city nursing home and is a professional music engraver.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains a small amount of correspondence, concert programs and advertisements, clippings, and photographs.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in two series:

did.unittitle: Correspondence, 1974-1991
Camenae String Quartet business cards, undated
Programs, 1972-1975
Programs, 1977-1979
Programs, 1980-1981
Programs, 1982-1983
Programs, 1984-1985

Clippings, 1974-1977
Clippings, 1978-1979
Clippings, 1980
Clippings, 1981
Clippings, 1982-1983
Clippings, 1984-1985
Programs and clippings, undated

Photographs,
1967-1985

scopecontent.p: Contains 34 photographs and several strips of negatives.
